meanings.definition: To make something erotic or sexually stimulating.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys eroticising her stories to make them more exciting.
meanings.sent2: The artist was known for eroticising his paintings with sensual themes.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked about eroticising the dessert with a sprinkle of chocolate.
meanings.sent4: His words had a way of eroticising even the simplest of topics.
meanings.sent5: The music video was a masterclass in eroticising dance moves.

meanings.definition: The act of turning something into an object of sexual desire.
meanings.sent1: The movie's eroticising of the main character made him a heartthrob.
meanings.sent2: In literature, the eroticising of characters adds depth to the story.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke about the eroticising of food got a big laugh.
meanings.sent4: The perfume's scent had a way of eroticising the wearer's presence.
meanings.sent5: The fashion designer's collection was a celebration of eroticising clothing.
